question.body: Which statement is true of the bonds in the water molecule?

multiple_choice.choice: Shared electrons spend more time around the oxygen atom.
Shared electrons spend more time around the hydrogen atom.
Shared electrons spend equal time around the oxygen and hydrogen atoms.
The bonds in water are ionic and no sharing of electrons occurs.
The bonds in water are nonpolar covalent.

response.feedback: Correct. The electrons spend more time on the electronegative oxygen atom. This creates a partial negative charge on the oxygen atom and an partial positive charge on the hydrogen atoms.
Incorrect. Oxygen is more electronegative than hydrogen, and electrons move to the more electronegative atom.
Incorrect. Oxygen is more electronegative than hydrogen, and electrons move to the more electronegative atom.
Incorrect. Bonds between the hydrogen and oxygen of water are covalent.
